text: Anaconda is the installer for Red Hat Linux and Fedora. It is written in Python and C, with a graphical interface using GTK+ 3 and PyGObject and a text inetrface using python-newt. A kickstart file can be used to automatically configure the installation, allowing users to run it without much supervision. Anaconda is used by RHEL, Fedora and a number of other projects, Anaconda offers a text-mode and GUI mode, so users can install on a wide range of systems. Anacondas are lizard-eating boas, and the Caldera installation program was called "Lizard", hence this name was chosen. == Other websites == *Anaconda home page Category:Red Hat
title: Anaconda (installer)
